\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
We study the perturbative dynamics of an infinite gravitating 
Nambu-Goto string within the general-relativistic perturbation
framework.
We develop the gauge invariant metric perturbation on a
spacetime containing a self-gravitating straight string with a
finite thickness and solve the linearized Einstein equation.
In the thin string case, we show that the string does not emit
gravitational waves by its free oscillation in the first order
with respect to its oscillation amplitude, nevertheless the
string actually bends when the incidental gravitational waves go
through it.
\end{abstract
